intro: Dammara brownii var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf dammara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported antifungal and anti-inflammatory properties.
